definitions.definition: a person who knows a lot about a particular subject because they have studied it in detail

examples.text: He was the most distinguished scholar in his field.
Literary scholars have argued about this matter for years.
She is the most distinguished scholar in her field.

definitions.definition: a student who has been given a scholarship to study at a school, college or university
a clever person who works hard at school

examples.text: I was never much of a scholar.

wordOrigin: Old English scol(i)ere ‘schoolchild, student’, from late Latin scholaris, from Latin schola, from Greek skholē ‘leisure, philosophy, lecture-place’.
